text:
The Lions Club of Ambur will soon take up cleaning works on one-km stretch of the Palar river.

According to a press release, C. Ramamoorthi, president of Lions Club of Ambur said during the inauguration of the club’s building. The river will be cleaned for a km from Devalapuram bridge. The work is likely to be launched this month.

Mecca Rafeeque Ahmed, chairman of Council for Leather Exports, while inaugurating the building, said India was the fastest growing country with seven per cent GDP growth in this recession period, the release said.

— Staff Reporter
title: Lions Club to clean up Palar for a km
